hedline.hl1: CANADA MOVES TO RELAX BANKING LAWS

abstract.p: Canada's Finance Min Paul Martin proposes changes in banking laws that would relax some ownership restrictions and give increased power to consumers (S)

block.p: Canada's finance minister, Paul Martin, proposed changes in banking laws that would relax some ownership restrictions and give increased power to consumers. Under the proposed legislation, banks will have to prepare public-impact reports for mergers and satisfy any concerns of the Competition Bureau, the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions and the minister of finance. To encourage competition, restrictions on foreign banks will be eased and capital requirements for new banks will be lowered. A Financial Consumer Agency of Canada and an ombudsman will monitor the sector and investigate complaints.
